Name: Figure of a cat
Description: Bronze figure of a cat, with incised markings at the ears and perhaps around the neck for a collar. The cat-goddess Bastet became prominent from the 22nd Dynasty onwards, when a family of kings from her cult-centre Bubastis sits on the throne. After 700 BC small figures of seated cats are commonly found at sites throughout Egypt, in connection with the large numbers of cats mummified and buried as votive offerings at that time.
